thread.title: The 30,000ft proposal! The moment an easyJet passenger asks his girlfriend to marry him over the intercom mid-flight
thread.title_full: The 30,000ft proposal! The moment an easyJet passenger asks his girlfriend to marry him over the intercom mid-flight | Daily Mail Online

author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: The 30,000ft proposal! The moment an easyJet passenger asks his girlfriend to marry him over the intercom mid-flight
text:
3
View
comments
It might not be everybody's idea of a romantic spot, but one man decided the cabin of an easyJet flight was a good place to propose to his girlfriend.
Kevin Christie, 41, was travelling with his 20-year-old partner Kamila Maier from Manchester to Mykonos, Greece, when he took to the intercom at 30,000ft to ask for her hand in marriage.
Thankfully she said yes - and the heartwarming event was captured on camera for posterity.
Kevin Christie gets down on one knee to ask for girlfriend Kamila Maier's hand in marriage
In front of 200 passengers on the budget airline flight, Mr Christie was introduced on the intercom by an air steward.
The Lincolnshire man then said: 'Hi baby, basically I'm just going to embarrass myself thoroughly in front of everyone here and say that I've loved you since the day I met you and I've have had the most amazing journey with you so far,' reported the Manchester Evening News .
 Next 'Hearty cheers, finest libations and sundowners': The... The last person you'd expect to see texting on take-off!... The ugly truth about those amazing Instagram shots:... Sensory explosion: The smell of espresso and fine leather in... 'So as we embark on this journey I just want to tell you, you are the most beautiful, most talented, most amazing girl in the whole world and I was wondering if you would do me the honour of marrying me.'
As the passengers applauded, Mr Christie got down on one knee in the aisle as he popped the question.
The Lincolnshire man took to the plane's tannoy system to propose to his partner, and right, he places the ring on her finger
'I was relieved when she said yes, it could have been very embarrassing if the answer went the wrong way - and a very long flight,' added the delighted husband-to-be.
The happy couple, who plan to marry in two years' time, met on Facebook through a mutual appreciation for Wimbledon Tennis.
MailOnline Travel have contacted easyJet for comment and is awaiting a response.
Mr Christie was introduced to the cabin by a member of cabin crew, and then took the phone
